results.title: The Space movie
results.creator_credit: Tony Palmer, Richard Branson and Simon Draper
results.brief_description: The Space Movie contains footage especially made available by NASA and the US National Archive, and includes never before seen colour film of the lunar landscape, man’s historic first walk on the moon, Mars, Venus and beyond. Music by Mike Oldfield.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Palmer, Richard Branson and Simon Draper

results.title: The Magic box
results.creator_credit: John Boulting, Richard Best, Ronald Neame and Festival Film Production
results.brief_description: A dramatised biography of William Friese-Greene (1855-1921), a British pioneer of the cinema. Adapted by Eric Ambler from the controversial biography by Ray Allister, the film contends that Friese-Greene was the true father of motion pictures, rather than the better known Thomas Edison. Told largely in flashback, the film details Friese-Greene’s tireless experimentation with the moving-image which mostly ended in failure and which eventually cost him his family and his reputation. The legitimacy of the claims for Friese-Greene became a central issue in the criticism of the film. Made for the 1951 Festival of Britain, ‘The Magic Box’ features Robert Donat in the lead role and a huge supporting cast including such British film luminaries as Joyce Grenfell, Miles Malleson, Michael Redgrave, Eric Portman, Emlyn Williams, Richard Attenborough, Peter Ustinov, Cecil Parker, Kay Walsh, and Laurence Olivier.

results.title: Mermaids
results.creator_credit: Richard Benjamin, Lauren Lloyd, Patrick Palmer, Wallis Nicita, Nicita/Lloyd Productions and Palmer
results.brief_description: Winona Ryder plays a strict Catholic schoolgirl growing up in the conservative early sixties and saddled with the grooviest and sexiest mother in town. A very funny romantic comedy, “Mermaids” celebrates the tensions, love and agonies of mother-daughter relationships. With Bob Hoskins and featuring an outstanding performance by Cher as the free-spirited mother of a very unconventional family. Based on the book by Patty Dann.

results.title: Fortress
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Raymond Menmuir and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Gabrielle Lord. A teacher and her class of nine students are kidnapped by four masked men and held for ransom. The victims plot to escape by outwitting their captors.

results.title: Le Dialogue des Carmelites = the Carmelites
results.creator_credit: Philippe Agostini, R.L. Bruckberger and Pierre Laurent
results.brief_description:
Two young carmelite novices take the veil almost on the eve of the French Revolution, and find themselves, their sister nuns and the convent itself caught up in the political events that follow.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Laurent ; director, Philippe Agostini, R. L. Bruckberger ; writers, Philippe Agostini, R. L. Bruckberger, Georges Bernanos ; photography, Andre Bac ; music, Jean Francaix.
Cast: Jeanne Moreau, Alida Valli, Pascale Audret, Madeleine Renaud, Pierre Brasseur, Georges Wilson.

results.title: The War room
results.creator_credit: Chris Hegedus, D.A. Pennebaker, Frazer Pennebaker, R.J. Cutter, Wendy Ettinger, Cyclone Films, Mc and Ettinger Films and Pennebaker Associates
results.brief_description: DA Pennebaker was a leading figure in the development of cinema-verite documentary, and in this fascinating film he turns his cameras on the campaign to elect Clinton for President in the 1992 US election. As we follow the campaign from Democrat preselection in New Hampshire to Clinton’s eventual ascendancy to the White House, what becomes clear is the paramount importance of the media’s role in contemporary American politics. The focus of the film is on Campaign Manager, James Carville, and the Communications Director, George Stephanopoulos, who led and directed the campaign. These two ferociously intelligent and dedicated men are aware of the complex and difficult questions concerning American democracy in the post Cold-War era, but their battle is attempting to address these issues in a society obsessed with the superficial and simplistic dominance of media images.

results.title: Hi 5 snow party
results.creator_credit: Helena Harris, Posie Graeme-Evans, Ian Munro, Kids Like Us, Nine Films and Television and Nine Network (Australia)
results.brief_description: The Hi5 gang - Tim Harding, Nathan Foley, Kathleen De Leon, Kellie Hoggart and Charli Robinson have lots of fun together, singing, dancing, telling stories and discovering how and why things happen. Suitable for lower primary school children.

results.title: Le Capitan
results.creator_credit: Andre Hunebelle, Paul Cadeac, Pierre Caband and Rene Bezard
results.brief_description:
In 1616 King Louis XIII is only 15 and his kingdom is administered by Regent Marie de Medicis and her favourite, Concini. Concini hopes to use power and influence to overthrow the young king but his plan is violently opposed by the peers of the Kingdom who have their own candidate to the succession, Charles d’Angouleme. As Concini terrorises his opponents, the kingdom is on the verge of a civil war. In order to save his life and his throne, the young king enlists the help of Francois, also known as Le Capitan, the best swashbuckler of the kingdom, and his sidekick, Cogolin.

Credits: Producers, Paul Cadeac, Pierre Caband, Rene Bezard ; director, Andre Hunebelle ; writers, Jean Halain, Pierre Foucaud, Andre Hunebelle ; photography, Marcel Grignon ; music, Jean Marion.
Cast: Pierrette Bruno, Lise Delamare, Annie Anderson, Guy Delorme, Jean Marais.

results.title: L'ecume des Jours = the Froth of Time
results.creator_credit: Charles Belmont, Andre Michelin and Philippe Senne
results.brief_description:
Colin, a rich and sentimental young man loves Chloe. His friend Chick shares his passion for literature and neglects his girlfriend Alise. Nicolas, driver and cook, is watching over this peaceful ‘world’. Colin’s life would be perfect, if only Chloe was not suffering from a mysterious disease.

Credits: Producers, Andre Michelin, Philippe Senne ; director, Charles Belmont ; writers, Charles belmont, Philippe Dumarcay, Pierre Pelegri ; photography, Jean-Jacques Rochut ; music, Andre Hodeir.
Cast: Jacques Perrin, Marie-France Pisier, Sami Frey, Alexandra Stewart, Annie Buron, Delphine Seyrig.

results.title: Wild in the country
results.creator_credit: Philip Dunne, Jerry Wald and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley plays troubled and angry local boy Glenn Talbot in this 1960’s adaptation of J.R. Salamanca’s novel “Wild in the Country”. The movie opens with Glenn and his brother brawling and the fight lands Glenn in front of the probation board yet again. The board gives him a second chance on the condition he is given into the custody of his Uncle and attends sessions with local psychologist Irene Spencer (Hope Lange). Glenn battles against his temper and old wild ways with the help of Irene who encourages him to pursue his writing and helps him get into college. The pair, high on Glenn’s success and sheltering from a storm in a motel, declare their love, but contain their desire for one another. Fearful of her feelings towards Glenn, Irene spurns his love by agreeing to marry another; Glenn, enraged by the news goes on a drunken spree and looks to be reverting back to his wicked ways. Cast also includes Tuesday Weld, Millie Perkins, John Ireland and Rafer Johnson.
